project.teaser: The Improving Digital Empowerment for Active Healthy Living project (IDEAHL) aims at developing and testing new models and approaches of (digital) health literacy ((d)HL) intervention development and application through the co-creation of a comprehensive and inclusive EU (d)HL...
project.objective:
The Improving Digital Empowerment for Active Healthy Living project (IDEAHL) aims at developing and testing new models and approaches of (digital) health literacy ((d)HL) intervention development and application through the co-creation of a comprehensive and inclusive EU (d)HL Strategy. The IDEAHL consortium is composed of 14 multi-disciplinary partners from 10 EU Member States, which work hand in hand with patients, citizens, and the broad socio-economic sector at local level.
The project will first conduct an extensive mapping of health literacy (HL) and (d)HL research, initiatives, and projects in the EU and beyond. It will define best practices and champions in these fields to foster knowledge exchange and uptake of selected practices. Building on these foundations, IDEAHL will launch a large co-creation process to design and plan its EU (d)HL Strategy. The project will involve over 1,300 different stakeholders, from citizens and patients to healthcare and social services, policy makers, non-health sectors, academia, etc.
The collected feedbacks will allow to develop an inclusive Strategy to improve (d)HL for the benefit of all citizens focusing on health promotion, disease prevention, treatment and (self-)care as well as on monitoring its impact on the wellbeing, productivity and the economy. The Strategy will pay special attention to social innovation, inclusion, gender, and ethics & privacy dimensions. Finally, a number of actions of the Strategy will be piloted in the 10 project countries. From the testing and evaluation of the pilots, IDEAHL will be able to put forward a common EU monitoring model and indicators for (d)HL levels.
The ultimate purpose of the project will be to empower EU citizens in using digital tools to take a more active role in the management of their own health and well-being, as well as supporting social innovations for person-centred care models.
project.title: Improving Digital Empowerment for Active Healthy Living
project.keywords: digital health literacy, health literacy, digital literacy, digital tools, citizens empowerment, co-creation, EU Strategy, active and healthy citizens

article.title: The making of the EU’s digital health strategy

result.title: Report on (d)HL
result.description: The findings from the analysis of tasks 11 12 and 13 will be gathered in a report to highlight the key factors drivers barriers and trends on dHL Information will describe target groups that IDEAHL will pay attention to The report will highlight best practices and define dHL champions and survivors It will include a core section on monitoring mechanisms and indicators drafting recommendations and guidelines for the IDEAHL dHL assessment model of task 33 Results will be published in scientific papers see WP5

result.title: IDEAHL inclusion, ethics & privacy toolkit V.3
result.description: Based on the direct experience of WP2 and WP3, the D4.1 report will be updated at M18 and M24 with recommendations about how to include the gender and cultural adaptation of (d)HL initiatives considering ethics compliance and the socio-economic framework in each EU country by policy makers and healthcare providers

result.title: Dissemination strategy V.2
result.description: Dissemination strategy outlining the roadmap monitoring and assessment of dissemination communication activities during the project It will be released at M3 and updated at M12 and M24

result.title: IDEAHL: Reviewing best practices for Digital Health Literacy interventions

details.authors: Thorup CB, Toft DS, Povlsen MB, Hæsum LKE.
details.journalTitle: COMET- conference in Cork in Ireland

result.title: EU Health Literacy Atlas
result.description: The first release of the new Atlas will be at M11. This version will be fed by results of D1.1. Then, the Atlas will be continuously updated throughout the project and beyond.

result.title: Report on (d)HL Strategy implementation
result.description: Each national coordinator will draft a report on the pilot of the Strategy describing the actions implemented, the results, the feedback collected from users, and the main success and challenges. D3.1 will also include a final section on the evaluation of the (d)HL Strategy. Questionnaires, interviews, and other aggregated data will be enclosed as annexes

result.title: IDEAHL inclusion, ethics & privacy toolkit V.2
result.description: Based on the direct experience of WP2 and WP3, the D4.1 report will be updated at M18 and M24 with recommendations about how to include the gender and cultural adaptation of (d)HL initiatives considering ethics compliance and the socio-economic framework in each EU country by policy makers and healthcare providers

result.title: Dissemination strategy V.3
result.description: Dissemination strategy outlining the roadmap, monitoring, and assessment of dissemination & communication activities during the project. It will be released at M3 and updated at M12 and M24.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - IDEAHL (Improving Digital Empowerment for Active Healthy Living)
result.teaser: Digital technologies empower citizens and professionals to manage health, support healthy aging, and improve disease prevention and treatment. Digital solutions that give citizens access to their personal health data are also central to supporting the transformation of care...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on policy-making event
result.description: Report summarising the key outcomes of the highlevel meeting organised with policy makers and the targets they validate for the dHL Strategys development

result.title: Aiming at improving digital empowerment for active healthy living of citizens in Europe
Exploitation & Sustainability plan
result.description: Exploitation & sustainability plan, considering all aspects necessary to facilitate the long-term implementation and scale-up of the EU (d)HL Strategy’s actions beyond the project. It will include a business and financial plan, as well as final replication guidelines.

details.authors: Jacob Østergaard Madsen, Charlotte Brun Thorup, Anesofie Bengtsen, Lisa Korsbakke Emtekær Hæsum

result.title: EU HL & (d)HL monitoring model schemes
result.description: Schemes with indicators, and guidelines for replication. Building on the outcomes of the entire project, an EU supporting framework for measuring and assessing health literacy levels in the EU will be prepared and disseminated among a wide range of stakeholders

result.title: Co-creation methodology
result.description: Cocreation methodology including a theoretical introduction and concrete design approach and methods per target group and country Operational steps for the implementation of the approaches proposed will be outlined together with a calendar of activities

details.authors: Pruneda González, L.; Cervilla, L.; Rey Hidalgo, I., López-Ventoso, M., Fernández García, C., Avagnina, B., Pisano González, M., IDEAHL Consortium

result.title: Report on co-creation
result.description: summarising the results of task 2.3 co-creation activities implemented by partners and the task 2.4 social media actions, as well as the co-design methods applied, and the main achievements and difficulties encountered. The report will foresee final conclusions and recommendations for future co-creation actions for (d)HL. D2.2 will also include an annex with short reports on each partner’s cocreation activities implemented at local level.

result.title: IDEAHL inclusion, ethics & privacy toolkit V.1
result.description: An overview on the general aspects to be considered in the elaboration and subsequent implementation of the dHL Strategy will be elaborated addressing inclusion gender and ethics privacy issues Implications relevant to data quality patientprofessional relationships and the equity of access to healthcare services as well as other potential questions arising from the utilisation of digital technologies in the healthcare settings will be explored

result.title: IDEAHL EU (d)HL Strategy
result.description: Based on the feedback emerged from co-creation, a European Strategy will be drafted, incl. the final list of dedicated actions to be pilot in WP3. The aim of the Strategy will be to bring the EU and Member States to an improved level of (d)HL. The Strategy will contain its own monitoring & assessment scheme and a set of indicators to evaluate progress and results

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
